newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end higher, but behind Dow rally.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end higher, but behind Dow rally.

text.p: Toronto stocks ended higher on Friday, but Canada's biggest stock market lagged behind Wall Street for a second straight day.
The TSE 300 Composite Index climbed 25.57 points to close at 5984.93 in heavy turnover of 105.5 million shares worth C$1.69 billion ($1.25 billion).
In New York, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rallied over 78 points to a record close of 6703.79.
The TSE 300 shrugged off early session losses due to weak bonds which tumbled on a buoyant U.S. employment report. The rebound was led by strong gains in gold and base metal stocks.
"Commodity prices in the last few weeks have been upticking and that has helped the Incos and Alcans," said John Ing, president of Maison Placements Canada.
Among the TSE's eight strong sectors, golds added 133 points and base metals improved 111 points.
Oil and gas, which climbed 88 points, received a boost from higher energy prices due to recent cold weather.
Toronto's six weak groups were led by financial services, communications and media, and consumer products.

In other news, Statistics Canada reported the Canadian economy created 34,000 jobs in December. Economists said the stronger employment growth confirmed that the economy was shifting into higher gear for 1997.
* Westar Group Ltd. led gainers, jumping 6 to close at a new high of 61. Analysts said the sale of a coal port was expected to yield a big cash windfall for Westar.
* Inco Ltd. led major miners, adding 1.50 to 45.50 on 520,000 shares. Among gold stocks, Placer Dome Inc. rose 1.20 to 29.40 on two million shares.

* Newbridge Networks Corp. soared 2.95 to 44.10 on 1.8 million shares amid rumors that it was in talks to set up a technology alliance with Ascend Communications. Newbridge declined comment on the rumors.
